meanings.definition: To surpass in war or battle.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight outwars the enemy in the fierce battle.
meanings.sent2: The army managed to outwars their opponents and claim victory.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant outwars the big grasshopper in their epic battle for a crumb.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen strategically outwars the opponent's rook.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outwars the villain, saving the city from destruction.

meanings.sent1: The general plans to outwars the enemy's defenses and secure the victory.
meanings.sent2: The army's tactics allowed them to outwars the opposing forces and advance.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers jokingly bet on who will outwars the other in the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent4: The ancient empire sought to outwars all neighboring kingdoms and expand its territory.
meanings.sent5: The skilled archers outwars the enemy's archers with their precise aim.

meanings.sent1: The martial artist's training helps him outwars his opponents in combat.
meanings.sent2: The warrior's determination allows him to outwars any challenges on the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully compete to see who can outwars the other in a friendly sparring match.
meanings.sent4: The champion boxer aims to outwars his rival and claim the title once again.
meanings.sent5: The skilled swordsman outwars his foes with swift strikes and agile movements.
